vistra.framework.util

Interface IBidirectIterator<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<E>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ITraversal
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImmutableBidirectIterator, Traversal

    public interface IBidirectIterator<E>
extends java.util.Iterator<E>
    A bidirectional iterator interface.
    Author:
    Roland Bruggmann (brugr9@bfh.ch)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasPrevious()
      Returns true if the iteration has more elements.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the iteration has no elements.
      E previous()
      Returns the previous element in the iteration.
      int size()
      Returns the size of the iterator.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.Iterator

        int size()
        Returns the size of the iterator.
        Returns:
        the size

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the iteration has no elements. (In other words, returns true if previous() or Iterator.next() would throw an exception.)
        Returns:
        true if the iteration has no elements

      • hasPrevious

        boolean hasPrevious()
        Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if previous() would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
        Returns:
        true if the iteration has more elements

      • previous

           throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Returns the previous element in the iteration.

        Throws:
